Two-thirds of beds in private hospitals from June to September 2020 were not used by the NHS, despite the NHS paying more than 1.6 billion to use them. This is despite more than 1.7 million waiting beyond the 18-week target for NHS treatment. https://t.co/8GPsMrxzH8

With hospitalisations and death rates below the 5 year average and we enter the summer season of lower NHS demand, what are the government doing to ensure that the NHS is ready for any winter surge in demand? Theyve had over a year to ensure that the NHS is protected.
